glossentry.glossdef: The heartbeat (HB) is part of the decision making process that allows the NCC to know if a site that may be protecting another site is in-service (IS) or out-of-service. Heartbeat communicates the state returned by Monitoring between sites. It only computes the status of another NCC if that site cannot be reached by heartbeat. It then uses the state used by other members it can see to deglosstermine that state. Heartbeat itself does not deglosstermine when an application takes over for the other site, it just provides the applications with the state of the other site. It is up to the application to decide what to do based on the state.

Helm uses a packaging format called charts. A chart is a collection of files that describe a related set of Kubernetes resources. A single chart might be used to deploy something simple, like a memcached pod, or something complex, like a full web app stack with HTTP servers, databases, caches, and so on.
High Level API microservice on the NCC SM. Mediates a high-level custom interface, often task based, into standard SM REST APIs.

Horizontal Pod Autoscaler (HPA) monitors workload and utilization of resources in a cluster, and based on the current need as well as specified utilization metrics and thresholds, dynamically adjusts the number of containers of a particular type.

Home Public Land Mobile Network identifies the Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) in which the profile of the subscriber is stored. Users roaming to other networks receives subscription information from the HPLMN.

Home Subscriber Service is the interconnection between the HLR (Home Location Register) and the AuC (Authentication Center) which are the two functions already present in pre-IMS 2G/GSM and 3G/UMTS networks.
Hyper Text Transfer Protocol is a communication protocol used for data transfer in Intranet and in the World Wide Web.
